title: Aluminum fell to 2,833.25 USD/T on November 27, 2025
summary: Aluminum prices declined 1.34% to $2,833.25 per tonne on November 27, 2025, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 2.29% decline. Despite recent weakness, aluminum remains 9.50% higher than a year ago, with prices rebounding from a near-one-month low of $2,790 reached on November 18th as macroeconomic tailwinds from Fed rate cut signals and Beijing stimulus measures lifted base metals.

title: Fastmarkets launches European aluminium scrap shredded old sheet taint tabor price assessment
summary: Fastmarkets launched a new price assessment for European aluminium scrap shredded old sheet on Friday, November 28, 2025, following a consultation period that began on October 29 and concluded on November 26. This development reflects ongoing efforts to establish standardized pricing mechanisms in the aluminum scrap market.

title: SMM: Three-Region Aluminum Ingot Inventory Falls to 441000 mt as of Nov 28
summary: Aluminum ingot inventory across three regions has declined to 441,000 mt. Secondary aluminum alloy prices are expected to fluctuate within a range in the short term, with price resilience remaining stable.

title: Hydro to idle European extrusions facilities
summary: Norway-based Norsk Hydro announced the closure of five European extrusion plants in the United Kingdom, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands to optimize its extrusion footprint in Europe. The closures will affect 730 employees and are scheduled for 2026, with the company citing the need for decisive action to strengthen long-term competitiveness in the European market.

title: Limited Commissioning of New Projects Leads to Slow Growth in China's Aluminum Capacity
summary: China's operating aluminum capacity increased by 538,000 mt in 2025 compared to the end of 2024, with aluminum production expected to grow by 1.7% year-over-year. Few new projects were commissioned during the year, but production is being boosted by earlier production cuts and resumption from technological transformation projects, with overall production expected to increase by 700,000–800,000 mt.

title: Researchers make incredible breakthrough using material from old cars
summary: A new recycled aluminum alloy called RidgeAlloy has been developed to address the challenge of recycling aluminum from old cars. This alloy is tough and can be produced rapidly, reducing energy use by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum processing, thus significantly lowering environmental impact.

title: Ball, Unilever show green aluminium can work
summary: Ball Corporation and Unilever are using aluminium produced with Alcoa's ELYSIS carbon-free smelting technology in aerosol cans, combining 50% ELYSIS aluminium and 50% post-consumer recycled content. This innovation reduces greenhouse gas emissions and represents a significant step in sustainable packaging and industrial collaboration.

title: Alcoa, Ball and Unilever debut carbon-free aluminium aerosol packaging
summary: Ahead of COP30, Alcoa, Ball, and Unilever launched an aerosol can made with 50% ELYSIS aluminium and 50% recycled content, eliminating direct greenhouse gas emissions through the ELYSIS process. This breakthrough could transform sustainable packaging in personal and home care sectors.

title: United States clean energy spending reaches a new high on EV surge, solar boom, and rising aluminium usage
summary: The surge in electric vehicle production in the US has increased demand for automotive-grade, low-carbon aluminium, which helps reduce emissions in EV parts. Manufacturers are raising recycled aluminium content to meet stricter emissions standards and consumer demand for sustainability.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup energy technology was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers to accelerate clean backup energy adoption. This technology offers a scalable, clean alternative to diesel generators, supporting net-zero operations in data centers.

title: Low-Carbon Metal Premiums: Market Trends & Price Evolution
summary: Sustainability premiums for low-carbon metals like aluminum are rising due to corporate decarbonization commitments and innovations such as renewable energy integration and inert anode technology. These trends are driving demand for low-carbon aluminum in automotive, electronics, and construction sectors.

title: Latest Update in the SMM Steel Billet Market
summary: Steel billet inventory in major stainless steel markets slightly increased by 0.64% week-on-week, indicating a limited supply-demand imbalance. Despite some recovery in stainless steel transactions, market sentiment remains weak with persistent destocking pressure and sluggish sales expected to limit steel price gains in December.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output up 0.9 percent in mid-November 2025, stocks also up
summary: China Iron and Steel Association reported a 0.9% increase in average daily crude steel output of large and medium-sized steel enterprises in mid-November compared to early November. Finished steel inventories also rose by 0.8% as of November 20, reflecting a moderate build-up in stock levels.

title: Daily Topic of China Bulk Commodity Data (November 28, 2025)
summary: On November 27, 2025, steel commodities showed a month-on-month price decline among eight steel products, contributing to a broader trend of price decreases in the steel sector. The overall commodity price index remained stable but significantly below its cycle peak, indicating ongoing market pressure.

title: Top news on China steel and other commodity markets
summary: Retail inventories of major carbon steel items in China have declined recently but at a slower pace. The report also highlights steady iron ore prices and procurement trends, suggesting cautious market activity amid fluctuating demand and supply conditions.

title: Fastmarkets amends Europe stainless steel scrap price assessments to domestic from import
summary: Fastmarkets changed its Europe stainless steel scrap price assessments from import to domestic delivery terms due to sporadic imports and more consistent domestic market liquidity. This adjustment aims to provide a more relevant pricing tool reflecting current market conditions.

title: JSW Steel Share Price Live Updates: JSW Steel's Final Trading Price
summary: JSW Steel's stock price showed a slight downturn with a -0.8% return for the week, indicating some negative market sentiment or pressure on steel sector equities.

title: Steel prices in the fourth week of November 2025 - Arab Iron and Steel
summary: Russian hot-rolled coil prices dropped by $15 to $430–445/ton FOB, while Chinese cold-rolled coil prices remained stable, reflecting regional variations in steel price trends during the fourth week of November.

title: LatAm steel faces rising imports threat
summary: Latin America's crude steel output has declined over 15 years, dropping to 50 million tonnes in 2025 from 67 million tonnes in 2010. Brazil's steel production fell by 1.8% year-to-date October, and Mexico's by 9%. Trade defense measures and import investigations on steel from China and India are impacting the market.

title: Minister Sidhu reinforces commitment to Canada's steel industry
summary: Canada's Minister of International Trade, Maninder Sidhu, will participate in an event highlighting the country's ongoing commitment to the steel industry, signaling government support and engagement with the sector.

title: November Crude Steel Production Figures Show Rise for Third Consecutive Month
summary: The World Steel Association reported a 24.2% increase in worldwide crude steel production in November 2025 compared to the previous year, marking the third consecutive month of growth in steel output globally.

title: Steel news and insights about steel market - steel prices - GMK Center
summary: Recent updates include a 3% year-on-year increase in global stainless steel production for January-September 2025, Spain's 5.4% production increase in the first half of 2025, and ArcelorMittal's temporary blast furnace shutdown in Poland due to import pressures. Other news covers price adjustments, production changes, and trade measures affecting steel markets worldwide.

title: How decarbonizing steel build a greener future
summary: Steel production is undergoing significant innovation to reduce carbon emissions, including the use of electric arc furnaces and green hydrogen. Projects like U.S. Steel's carbon capture plant in Indiana aim to mineralize CO₂ emissions, while green hydrogen initiatives in the UAE and Sweden could cut steelmaking emissions by up to 95%. Government support is crucial to offset higher costs and encourage demand for green steel.

title: Stegra Secures $41 Million from Sweden to Support Net Zero Steel Project
summary: Sweden has allocated $41 million in state financing to Stegra to advance a near-zero emissions steel project. The Boden plant will integrate renewable electricity, on-site hydrogen production, and a fully integrated steelmaking process to eliminate nearly all carbon emissions. This project is a key test for Europe's ability to decarbonize heavy industry while maintaining competitiveness.

title: A door to the future – how a dam gate shows the potential of fossil-free steel
summary: HYBRIT technology will produce the world's largest fossil-free steel structure, a 21-meter dam gate to be installed in Sweden by 2028. This steel, made using hydrogen instead of coal, could reduce global CO₂ emissions by 7%. The project demonstrates high-quality fossil-free steel production and signals industrial possibilities for decarbonized steel.

title: Green Steel Future
summary: Tata Steel is investing £1.25 billion in electric arc furnace technology at its Port Talbot site to cut CO₂ emissions by nearly 90%. This transformation aims to establish the UK as a leader in green steelmaking, supporting the manufacturing sector and reducing industrial energy costs with government collaboration.

title: Sustainability Indicators Report 2025
summary: The steel industry is committed to decarbonization and sustainability, using 19 indicators to measure economic, environmental, social, and governance performance. The report highlights challenges and pathways to reduce CO₂ emissions, emphasizing transparent data disclosure and continuous improvement in environmental performance.

title: The Cascabel Copper-Gold Mine Is Expected to Commence Production in 2028; LME Copper Fluctuated and Closed Lower Overnight
summary: LME copper futures opened at $10,910/mt and closed slightly lower at $10,930/mt, down 0.21%. Market trading was sluggish due to the Thanksgiving holiday, with supply of imported and domestic copper decreasing and purchasing sentiment declining amid rising prices. Overall, copper prices are expected to find support despite reduced demand and geopolitical uncertainties.

title: Copper prices rise after Nvidia's results, but the dollar is still strong
summary: Copper prices edged up following strong earnings from Nvidia, with the LME three-month copper price rising 0.3% to $10,784 per metric ton. However, a strong US dollar and weak demand from China, including a 22.1% annual drop in copper cathode imports, continue to weigh on the market. Analysts expect ongoing consolidation after recent price setbacks.

title: Copper set for weekly gains on US rate cut optimism
summary: Copper prices are poised to end the week higher, supported by soft US economic data that increased expectations of a Federal Reserve rate cut in December. The LME three-month copper price rose 0.50% to $10,994 per ton, with Shanghai Futures Exchange prices also up. A weaker US dollar helped commodity prices, although resistance remains near $11,000 per ton.

title: SunSirs: Copper Prices Skyrocket by 20,000 RMB/Ton
summary: Copper prices have surged by over 20,000 RMB per ton this year, reaching historic highs above $11,200 per ton on the LME and nearly 90,000 RMB per ton on the Shanghai Futures Exchange. This price boom supports increased processing of lower-grade copper ores. The rise is driven by demand from emerging industries and strong upstream production.

title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
summary: TD Securities expects London-traded copper to maintain recent gains into 2026 following a record high in October. Aluminium and zinc prices show mixed outlooks, while nickel faces oversupply concerns. The forecast reflects cautious sentiment amid evolving economic and supply-demand factors in the base metals market.

title: BHP bets big on Chile's copper boom
summary: BHP's Escondida mine increased copper output by 4% to 494,000 tonnes in FY26, driven by record throughput and improved recoveries. Copper demand is forecast to rise 70% between 2021 and 2050, positioning Chile as a key supplier. The ramp-up of new projects like the Full SaL project supports production growth amid strong market demand.

title: Copper breaks above USD11,000 on increased likelihood of US rate cut
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the London Metal Exchange rose 1.3% to $10,963 per metric ton amid growing expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. The price surge reflects optimism about softer monetary policy supporting industrial metals demand.

title: The Cascabel Copper-Gold Mine Is Expected to Commence Production in 2028
summary: SolGold has accelerated development of its Cascabel copper-gold project in northern Ecuador, with preliminary engineering set to begin in 2026 and first production expected in 2028. The news comes amid fluctuating copper prices and shifting global supply dynamics.

title: BHP bets big on Chile's copper boom
summary: BHP's Escondida mine in Chile started the 2025–26 financial year with a 4% increase in copper output, reaching 494,000 tonnes. The company is expanding production amid rising global demand and ongoing infrastructure developments.

title: Copper smelters idle as China slows
summary: Global copper smelting activity declined in October, with inactive capacity rising to 15.1% of world nameplate—the highest this year. China drove most of the decline, with inactivity jumping to 13.8%, while other regions saw modest improvements.

title: China's overcapacity crackdown reaches copper, but market impact unlikely
summary: China has shelved several planned copper smelters as part of its overcapacity crackdown, but the move is not expected to significantly impact the market. The government's actions are aimed at curbing excess industrial capacity.

title: China's Grip on Copper Sets Scene for Make-or-Break Supply
summary: China's copper smelting expansion and structural shifts in copper concentrate supply are creating stress on the global pricing mechanism. Chinese smelters continue to secure raw materials despite low processing charges, benefiting from surging refined copper prices used in construction and electrical wiring.

title: [Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices dropped slightly on November 27, US extends some tariff exemptions for China
summary: Nickel prices slightly declined on November 27, with the SMM #1 refined nickel average price dropping to 119,000 yuan/mt, down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day. Futures on SHFE also fell by 0.35%-0.61%. Market sentiment was influenced by dovish signals from US Fed officials and positive China-US diplomatic communications, though long-term price pressure remains.

title: On November 28, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 117,000-122,000 yuan/mt, with an average price of 119,500 yuan/mt, up 500 yuan/mt from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices rebounded slightly on November 28, with the SMM #1 refined nickel average price rising by 500 yuan/mt to 119,500 yuan/mt. This indicates a short-term recovery following the previous day's decline, reflecting ongoing market fluctuations.

title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
summary: TD Securities forecasts nickel prices to plateau in 2026 amid global economic growth concerns and potential delays in US interest rate cuts. While Beijing’s stimulus measures may support demand, nickel faces oversupply worries. A modest price rebound is expected in 2027, reflecting cautious market sentiment.

title: Nickel's Wild Ride: What's Driving Prices and Future Demand?
summary: Nickel prices have been volatile in 2025 due to recession fears, increased supply from Indonesia and the Philippines, and shifting trade policies. The market faces oversupply risks, but strong electric vehicle demand and geopolitical factors could support prices. Analysts predict nickel will trade between $15,000 and $18,000 per metric ton in 2025 with ongoing volatility.

title: LME nickel prices on Nov 25 rise as weaker US dollar & rate-cut expectations boost market sentiment
summary: LME nickel futures rose by $173/ton to close at $14,872/ton on November 25, supported by a weaker US dollar and increased expectations of US Federal Reserve rate cuts. The spot price also increased, reflecting improved market sentiment.

title: FLASH: Nickel 28 reports 34.33% rise in Q3 2025 nickel production
summary: Nickel 28 announced a 34.33% year-on-year increase in nickel production at the Ramu nickel-cobalt project in Papua New Guinea for Q3 2025, producing 9,242 tonnes of nickel contained in mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP). Cobalt production also rose to 887 tonnes. The project benefited from no unplanned outages or scheduled maintenance, with net cash costs at $3.07 per pound of nickel produced.

title: Nickel 28 Releases Ramu Q3 2025 Operating Performance
summary: Nickel 28 reported strong Q3 2025 results with 9,242 tonnes of contained nickel and 887 tonnes of cobalt produced in MHP, surpassing last year's figures. Nickel sales reached 9,880 tonnes, exceeding production and reducing inventory. CEO Craig Lennon highlighted uninterrupted production and expects continued strong sales into Q4 2025 despite a slight decrease in average nickel prices.

title: SPC Nickel highlights Muskox's geological potential
summary: SPC Nickel revealed assay results from its 2025 exploration program at the Muskox Project in Nunavut, Canada, emphasizing the project's unique geological potential and positioning it as a leading exploration opportunity. The Muskox Property is a large-scale metal-bearing district with potential for multiple deposits, comparable to major copper-nickel camps globally. The report also notes global nickel demand is forecast to rise steadily, driven by electric vehicle battery growth.

title: Lifezone Metals Advances Kabanga Nickel Project Toward 2026 Final Investment Decision
summary: Lifezone Metals is progressing the Kabanga Nickel Project with a targeted final investment decision (FID) in late 2026. The project holds about 50 million tons of reserves at 1.9-2% nickel grades and offers robust economics with a $1.6 billion NPV and 23.3% IRR. The project uses a hydrometallurgical process with renewable energy, aiming for sustainable nickel production aligned with tightening environmental regulations.

title: MHP Payables Under Pressure, High-Grade Nickel Matte's Survival Room to be Further Squeezed
summary: Analysis indicates that MHP (Mixed Hydroxide Precipitate) nickel capacity is ramping up with expected production growth over 35% in 2026, while cobalt prices rise sharply due to DRC policies. This dynamic pressures high-grade nickel matte, which faces a narrower survival window due to cost competitiveness challenges. The nickel market shows unusual price relationships, impacting raw material competition and market strategies for 2026.

title: Base Metal Prices Face Growth Uncertainty
summary: Financial firm TD Securities forecasts nickel prices to plateau in 2026 with a modest rebound expected in 2027. The outlook reflects concerns about oversupply and cautious market sentiment amid various economic and supply-demand factors affecting base metals.

title: China's Nickel-Free EV Batteries Hit Indonesia's Nickel Plan
summary: A new report from Energy Shift Institute highlights how China's development of nickel-free electric vehicle batteries is impacting Indonesia's nickel strategy, potentially affecting demand and market dynamics for nickel producers.

title: Nickel Industry - Innovations and Sustainability in Nickel Production
summary: Dr. Mark McArthur of NOVONIX discusses a patented, all-dry, zero-waste cathode synthesis technology that significantly reduces costs and environmental impact in nickel-based cathode production. The article highlights nickel's potential as a sustainable material throughout its entire value chain, emphasizing its role in electric vehicle batteries and climate-neutral technologies.

title: Low-Carbon Metal Premiums: Market Trends & Price Evolution
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) is advancing initiatives to establish low-carbon price premiums for nickel and other metals, incentivizing sustainable production. This market-based mechanism supports decarbonization by financially rewarding environmentally friendly production methods, driven by demand from automotive and battery manufacturing sectors.

title: Benchmark Opens Public Consultation on Changes to Sustainable Nickel Grades
summary: Benchmark Minerals has initiated a public consultation to revise its Sustainable Nickel grades, reflecting evolving standards in sustainability criteria for nickel production. This move aims to enhance transparency and promote sustainable practices within the nickel supply chain.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the Group comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation, with 93% of employees on permanent contracts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: EC approves Cogne's acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from Salzgitter
summary: The European Commission cleared Cogne Acciai Speciali's acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from German steelmaker Salzgitter. The €135 million deal expands Cogne's footprint in seamless tubes and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes markets, with no competition concerns raised by the EC.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali acquisition by Mannesmann Stainless Tubes is complete
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed its acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes, further strengthening its position in the stainless steel and nickel alloy sectors. This acquisition follows regulatory approval and is part of Cogne's strategic expansion.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali expects to receive €31.56 million in funding from Walsin Lihwa Corporation
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali announced it will receive approximately €31.56 million in gross proceeds through the issuance of 23,552,150 common shares at €1.34 each. Walsin Lihwa Corporation, a returning investor, will maintain its 100% stake in the company following the transaction.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris hosted a panel discussion in Italy on the future of nuclear energy and its impact on the country's boilermaking industry. The event highlighted advances in nuclear technology and safety, and Tenaris announced its Italian mill's accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities under the ASME III standard. The company emphasized its commitment to quality and safety in supporting Europe's decarbonization goals.

title: Italy's Prysmian sees stronger U.S. pricing, margins after new copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian expects to benefit from the new U.S. copper tariff scheme that imposes a 50% levy on foreign-made cables, improving its pricing and margins in the U.S. market. The company, which produces cables in the U.S., will avoid the cost disadvantages faced by importers from other countries, supporting its full-year profit and cash generation forecasts.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian is investing heavily in R&D in Italy, with €216 million spent between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The Milan R&D center is central to Prysmian’s innovation strategy, focusing on energy transition and digital transformation, supported by Italian government funding and initiatives like the Green New Deal for submarine energy cables.

title: Prysmian Could Be a Relative Winner From Trump's Copper Tariff
summary: Analysts at Citi suggest Prysmian could benefit from the U.S. 50% copper tariff due to its vertically integrated copper operations in the U.S., including a copper rod mill in Texas. This gives Prysmian a competitive edge over smaller players and could positively impact its stock performance in the short term.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue and earnings above forecasts, driven by strong growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company’s performance in North America and Europe, along with a stable high-voltage backlog, supports optimism for future growth, with analysts noting potential benefits from copper tariffs in 2026.

title: Prysmian Raises Annual Targets After Record Q3 Performance
summary: Following a historically strong third quarter, Prysmian has raised its full-year 2025 financial targets. The company’s robust revenue growth and strategic focus on key markets underpin its optimistic outlook for the remainder of the year.
